data.description:
Chrono Weaver is a single-player co-op time-travel puzzle game. Work with copies of yourself as you travel through space and time, finding solutions to seemingly impossible tests. Explore a beautifully crafted mysterious world guided by an unusual flying robot. In this demo play through a full-featured shortened version of the game and experience time-bending fun.

MASTER TIME-TRAVEL TO WORK WITH YOURSELF
Donâ€™t have friends to play with you? No problem! In Chrono Weaver you use time-travel to solve co-op puzzles by yourself! Use the Origin Point Device to spawn the next version of you and then set off solving one part of the puzzle. Your co-worker, also powered by you, will work at the same time solving a different part. 

SOLVE UNIQUE PHYSICS BASED PUZZLES
Use your wits to discover the puzzling path to the data disk aided by buttons, levers, ropes, bouncers, and more. A whole new dimension opens up when you can be in multiple places at once, and physics is way more fun in VR. Bringing both of these things together creates something you have to experience to understand.

SLINGSHOT YOUR WAY ACROSS A BEAUTIFUL WORLD
Demonstrate your accuracy and precision with the amazing Quantum Slingshot. Use this slingshot to make impossible shots in a desolate research facility. There are twists and turns all around, and lots to discover in this story rich environment. There are things to throw and cans to crush in our physics based world that takes full advantage of VR.

changelog.change_log:
Patch 2.2 - Subtitles!

- Added full English Subtitles avaiable through the Audio settings menu.
- Fixed some bugs around level streaming. Ideally no more void hallways!
- Retry lever replaced with a handle pull to reduce confusion on its purpose
- Door displays have been updated to show if they are locked or unlocked

- Hands on Oculus Grab Markers better\n
- Grabbing of physics objects significantly improved. Especially the left hand.\n
- The Timeline tutorial now includes teaching the Flip Menu.\n
- Yoto explains more about the puzzles, including circuits and reminding the player about the flip menu\n
- TIM now only requires 1 lever pull and 1 lever push between timelines.\n
- Goal holders should now turn off when the goal isn't moving.\n
- Circuits now flash blue when on and are red when off.\n
- Removed some doors that were only 6ft high. Sorry tall people!\n
- Added a flip menu tutorial in the main menu for people in strange level completion states.\n
- Added the ribbon effect to the tutorial and target practice balls\n
- Added VFX for bounce scores\n
- Added new SFX for getting highscores on puzzles. Can you make the angels sing?\n
- Added a visual display for the tutorial to help people who miss what Yoto is saying\n
- Improved functionality of the flip menu to remove accidental uses\n
- Improved some visuals around the flip menu\n
- Fixed bugs with TIM spawning at the wrong height\n
- Fixed bugs with you not teleporting to TIM when transfering between timelines\n
- Fixed bugs relating to levels not loading correctly

Patch 2.0.1
- Fixed a bug with the doors locking you out on the last level
- Fixed some bugs around taking your headset off and putting it back on causing you to tunnel through the floor. (Still don't do this in the elevator)
- Adjusted an early level to make the first shot easier to hit
- Fixed the Office not loading in at the right time
- Fixed the moving walls being different in both eyes sometimes
- Grip Strength changed to make holding onto the ball easier
- Fixed an issue with one of the masks not being wearable
- Made it so the past you no longer stops you from pulling the lever of the time machine.
- Adjusted the window in Push My Buttons to be more visible
- Improved slingshot indicator
- Fixed the level loading bubble
- Added text around restarting the game in a failed state
- adjusted the brightness of the elevator button glow
